content.claim_summary: During a 25-minute 101 call, the handler mocks and obstructs a high-risk victim, denies Victims’ Code rights, misstates GDPR to withhold bail status, and gives inconsistent case-status information while refusing to log new harassment.
key_points: Invalidation/humiliation: 'You're not dead, are you?' followed by 'I'm not a ghost. That was insulting.'
Victims’ Code denial: 'You don't get to quote the Victim's Code and then get exactly what you want.'
GDPR misapplied to refuse bail-status confirmation despite verified identity.
Obstruction of logging new incidents (calls/messages/rape accusation) as a new matter.
Inconsistent case status: 'no officer attached' vs. 'PC Dixon is dealing with it'.
Unacknowledged disclosures: caller reports 45 prior contacts without callback.

contradictions.claim: Callback/right to update refused after citing the Victims’ Code.
legal_risks: Victims’ Code (England & Wales) — right to updates/callbacks

contradictions.claim: Bail status withheld as 'GDPR', not policy/judgment-based disclosure.
legal_risks: DPA 2018 (Part 3) — accuracy/necessity; improper reliance on GDPR label

contradictions.claim: Handler says no officer; later states PC Dixon is the officer.
Refusal to treat fresh harassment report as new crime/update.
Victim states 45 calls with no callback; not visible/acted upon.
Derisive framing of suicide attempt ('You're not dead, are you?').
legal_risks: Professional Standards/Code of Ethics — respect and empathy deficits
